document.heading: Police Officers, Fire Fighters, and Teachers Retirement Benefit Replacement Plan Temporary Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-58, the “Police Officers, Fire Fighters, and Teachers Retirement Benefit Replacement Plan Temporary Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-383. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 24, 1997, and October 7, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 22, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-189 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-58 became effective on March 20, 1998.
